solution_line_template: First subtract the cost of Mark's groceries from the amount he gives the cashier to find how much he gets in change: ${cash_given} - ${bread_cost} - ${cheese_cost} = $<<{cash_given}-{bread_cost}-{cheese_cost}={total_change}>>{total_change}

Then subtract the value of a quarter in cents (25) and the value of a dime in cents (10) from the change amount to find how much Mark gets paid in nickels: ${total_change} - ${quarter_value} - ${dime_value} = $<<{total_change}-{quarter_value}-{dime_value}={change_in_nickels_amount}>>{change_in_nickels_amount}

Now divide the amount Mark gets in nickels by the value per nickel in cents (5) to find how many nickels Mark gets: ${change_in_nickels_amount} / ${nickel_value}/nickel = <<{change_in_nickels_amount}/{nickel_value}={num_nickels}>>{num_nickels} nickels
